hero.title: Efficiency and Culture in Balance
hero.intro: We support mid-sized industrial companies in transformation processes where operational efficiency, leadership and organizational culture are equally critical. Practical, leadership-driven and effective in daily operations.

pillars.title: What we stand for
pillars.subtitle: Execution, rhythm and anchoring in daily work.

items.title: Execution over concepts
items.text: Clear structure, accountability and hands-on implementation – without excessive slide decks.

items.title: Leadership as leverage
items.text: Transformation succeeds through leadership. That’s where we start and create impact across processes, interfaces and teams.

items.title: Impact over methods
items.text: Methods are a means to an end. What matters is what actually works and lasts in daily operations.

divider.title: Less abstraction. More daily reality.
divider.text: We work where impact is created: in routines, interfaces and leadership rhythms. Not only as concepts, but in a way that holds up in day-to-day operations.

approach.title: Approach
approach.intro: Our approach is clearly structured and consistently focused on execution in day-to-day operations. We work with leadership, clarify decisions, and embed change where routines, collaboration and accountability create impact.
principles: We work with leadership in daily operations: We structure roles, establish decision and steering cadences, and make accountability effective.
We make impact measurable: We define KPIs, standards and routines—and follow through consistently.
We embed change sustainably: We integrate new ways of working into routines, collaboration, culture and identity.

how.title: From trigger to execution — in three steps.
how.subtitle: Not as a concept, but so it works in the day-to-day: clarify together, lead in daily operations, embed consistently.

steps.text: We understand the current situation, constraints and dynamics—and make the first robust decisions on target state and priorities.
We set up a leadership and steering cadence: routines, KPIs and standards that stabilize collaboration and execution.
We secure impact through follow-up, accountability and cultural fit—until it runs without external support.

about.title: About
intro: More than 25 years of hands-on industrial and leadership experience are combined with technical expertise as well as knowledge in business administration and business psychology. We support industrial mid-sized companies where concepts exist, but implementation in daily operations falls short – and where efficiency, leadership and organizational culture must be developed together.
Our strength lies in connecting operational reality with management perspective, ensuring that change becomes effective and sustainable in everyday work.
about.profileText:
Acceptance emerges when language, reality and responsibility align.

I work from direct experience in an industrial environment – on the shopfloor, in leadership and in management. This shapes my approach:
Change must fit operational reality, be taken up by leadership and be anchored in everyday work.

This is how implementation emerges – not something that needs to be explained, but something that is carried and lived.

speaking.title: Talks & Teaching
speaking.intro: In talks and teaching formats, I speak about leadership, change, and operational reality — not from theoretical distance, but from responsibility in day-to-day practice. The goal is orientation, clear framing, and practical relevance.

topics.title: Efficiency and Culture in Balance
topics.subtitle: Why transformations fail — and what makes them work
topics.description: Transformation is never purely technical; it is always cultural as well. When strategies fail in everyday reality, it is often the tension between efficiency pressure and loss of identity. This talk shows how to connect both perspectives so change is not only designed, but understood and carried in daily operations.

topics.title: Shopfloor Leadership
topics.subtitle: Leading through rhythm, not firefighting
topics.description: Impact is created where value is produced. When shopfloor leadership is replaced by constant firefighting, stability is lost. I show how clear routines, meaningful metrics, and a reliable leadership cadence create orientation — and make accountability effective where problems actually arise.

topics.title: Lean Management
topics.subtitle: Daily impact instead of a toolbox obsession
topics.description: Lean is not a toolbox; it is a logic of simplification and learning. Many initiatives fail not because methods are missing, but because they do not fit daily reality. This impulse focuses on a few levers that stabilize standards, problem solving, and collaboration — without ‘method hunting’.

topics.title: M&A Integration
topics.subtitle: Culture, identity, and the operating model before and after the deal
topics.description: The economic success of mergers is decided after closing — in collaboration, leadership, and identity. Drawing on practice and DBA research, I highlight how culture and identity can be addressed early and how an operating model can be shaped to protect performance without destroying the cultural DNA that made the business successful.

topics.title: Change Governance
topics.subtitle: Decide, communicate, embed
topics.description: Change needs a clear frame; otherwise ambiguity and friction take over. Change governance is the operating system of transformation: decision paths, roles, cadence, and communication. This talk shows how to build governance pragmatically so decisions stick, communication builds trust, and new ways of working don’t fade out.

topics.title: Leadership in Transition
topics.subtitle: Role, impact, accountability
topics.description: In transformation phases, expectations on leaders shift markedly: from subject-matter expert to a builder of orientation, accountability, and collaboration. I reflect on how leadership stays effective under uncertainty, how roles are clarified, and how accountability is placed where it truly matters in daily operations.
